name: Singapore Polical History
description: Contain questions about Singapore's key historical events in political.

examples.input:
Who was the first Prime Minister of Singapore?
A) Lee Kuan Yew
B) Goh Chok Tong
C) S. Rajaratnam
D) Tony Tan

In what year did Singapore gain independence from Malaysia?
A) 1963
B) 1964
C) 1965
D) 1966

Who succeeded Lee Kuan Yew as Prime Minister in 1990?
A) Lee Hsien Loong
B) Tony Tan
C) Goh Chok Tong
D) S. Rajaratnam

What was the name of the merger between Singapore and Malaysia from 1963 to 1965?
A) The Malaysian Federation
B) The Federation of Malaysia
C) The Malaysian Union
D) The United Federation of Malaya

Who is the Prime Minister of Singapore as of 2023?
A) Tharman Shanmugaratnam
B) Goh Chok Tong
C) Lee Hsien Loong
D) Halimah Yacob

What is the name of Singapore's first President?
A) S.R. Nathan
B) Yusof Ishak
C) Benjamin Sheares
D) Devan Nair

Which Singaporean Prime Minister is known for initiating the 'Singapore 21' and 'Renaissance City' plans?
A) Lee Kuan Yew
B) Goh Chok Tong
C) Lee Hsien Loong
D) S. Rajaratnam

When did Singapore become a founding member of the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN)?
A) 1965
B) 1966
C) 1967
D) 1968

Which document serves as the supreme law of Singapore?
A) The Singapore Act
B) The Constitution of Singapore
C) The Basic Law of Singapore
D) The Singapore Charter

Who was the first Chief Minister of Singapore?
A) Lim Yew Hock
B) David Marshall
C) Lee Kuan Yew
D) Goh Keng Swee

Which year saw the introduction of the Group Representation Constituency (GRC) system in Singapore?
A) 1986
B) 1987
C) 1988
D) 1989

What is the primary legislative body in Singapore?
A) Senate of Singapore
B) Parliament of Singapore
C) House of Representatives
D) National Assembly

Who was the President of Singapore before Halimah Yacob?
A) S.R. Nathan
B) Tony Tan
C) Ong Teng Cheong
D) Sellapan Ramanathan

In which year did Lee Kuan Yew step down as Prime Minister?
A) 1989
B) 1990
C) 1991
D) 1992

Which year marked the introduction of the Non-Constituency Member of Parliament (NCMP) scheme in Singapore?
A) 1984
B) 1986
C) 1990
D) 1994

Which constituency did Workers' Party win in the 2011 General Elections, marking a historic victory?
A) Aljunied GRC
B) Hougang SMC
C) Marine Parade GRC
D) Punggol East SMC

When was the Workers' Party of Singapore founded?
A) 1950
B) 1957
C) 1965
D) 1972

When was the People's Action Party of Singapore founded?
A) 1950
B) 1954
C) 1957
D) 1972

In which year did Singapore host its first General Election after gaining independence?
A) 1965
B) 1968
C) 1970
D) 1972

What significant political event occurred in Singapore in 1963?
A) Separation from Malaysia
B) Singapore's merger with Malaysia
C) Introduction of the Elected President scheme
D) Formation of the PAP

When was the first National Day Parade held in Singapore?
A) 1963
B) 1965
C) 1966
D) 1967
